events.name: Touch the clouds #1
events.description:
We would like to invite you to the next meeting organized by GDG Pozna≈Ñ!‚òÅÔ∏è

Our first speaker will be Pranjal Agrawal- Software developer and cloud engineer from Google Warsaw! Pranjal will tell us about deploying applications on Google Cloud.
"Google cloud offers many possibilities to deploy applications - Google Compute Engine, App Engine, Cloud Functions, Google Kubernetes Engine, etc., which differ vastly in the required setup and the methodology of resource management (automatic vs. manual). This talk will be an introduction (with a live demo) to deploying applications on the Google Cloud Platform. Be it a simple server, a script running a periodic job, or a complex distributed system, GCP offers myriad of ways to handle these scenarios which we will explore in detail. I will demonstrate by deploying an application on various platforms, connecting it with data stores, etc. Hopefully this will serve as a broad scope introduction to Google Cloud Platform and enable listeners to choose the product and setup for their needs."

Our second speaker will be Jakub Holak- Lead Front End Developer from Nordcloud:
"Almost all modern apps are real-time. Think gaming, Uber, Messanger or Twitter. It is not obvious how to achieve that kind of dynamism in serverless architectures - so I would love to present how one can leverage public cloud services to do so. Let's use AppSync and API Gateway and get our data ASAP! #graphql #amplify"

We also invite you to pizza & networking! üçï

More information about agenda soon.

Please sign up via this link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1U4eM21R5XN6L0izhItwt9k0HGayts3MfG7dUP_FZLKg

The number of places is limited!

#gdgPoznan #TouchTheClouds

events.name: GDG Pozna≈Ñ: Android Meetup #2
events.description:
Cze≈õƒá!

Chocia≈º ≈õwiƒôta ju≈º za nami, my mamy dla Was prezent: rezerwujcie termin 16 stycznia na drugie spotkanie z serii o Androidzie.

Przedstawiamy naszƒÖ pierwszƒÖ prelegentkƒô - bƒôdzie niƒÖ Paulina Sadowska, programistka Androida w Allegro. Po godzinach autorka artyku≈Ç√≥w na Medium, w kt√≥rych pisze g≈Çownie o RxJavie, wydajno≈õci i ≈Çadowaniu obrazk√≥w.

Kolejnym prelegentem bƒôdzie Bart≈Çomiej Osma≈Çek, Android Developer w Droids on Roids oraz wsp√≥≈Çorganizator GDG Wroc≈Çaw.

Agenda
16:45 - 17:00 Rejestracja
17:00 - 17:55 Paulina Sadowska: "Practical guide to performance Benchmarks - automatically detect inefficient code like Google"
17:55 - 18:10 przerwa
18:10 - 19:05 Bart≈Çomiej Osma≈Çek: "Wprowadzenie do Kotlin Coroutines"
19:05 - networking + pizza

Opis prelekcji:

1. Paulina Sadowska: "Practical guide to performance Benchmarks - automatically detect inefficient code like Google"

Tworzenie wydajnych aplikacji Androidowych nie jest prostym zadaniem, zw≈Çaszcza gdy nad jednym projektem pracuje wiele zespo≈Ç√≥w. Nie wszystkie problemy ≈Çatwo zauwa≈ºyƒá w profilerze, a gdy ju≈º je znajdziemy, poprawa nieoptymalnego kodu bez zmiany jego dzia≈Çania bywa czasoch≈Çonna.

A co je≈õli mo≈ºna inaczej?

W prezentacji przedstawiƒô, na praktycznych przyk≈Çadach, jak korzystajƒÖc z biblioteki Benchmark, mo≈ºna ≈Çatwo eksperymentowaƒá i wykrywaƒá pogorszenia wydajno≈õci.
Poka≈ºƒô te≈º jak Google wykorzystuje Banchmarki w zintegrowanym z CI narzƒôdziu, kt√≥re pozwala na automatyczne wykrycie potencjalnych problem√≥w z wydajno≈õciƒÖ tu≈º po wprowadzeniu nowych zmian w kodzie.

2. Bart≈Çomiej Osma≈Çek: "Wprowadzenie do Kotlin Coroutines"

Bartek przedstawi Wam podstawy Kotlin Coroutines - opisze ich dzia≈Çanie, poka≈ºe podstawowe elementy API, przyk≈Çady u≈ºycia oraz przeka≈ºe kilka wskaz√≥wek z pracy z tƒÖ bibliotekƒÖ.

- - - - - - -

Zapisy na wydarzenie: https://forms.gle/dTWGL4zajMK6RGh46

- - - - - - -

od teraz mo≈ºesz ≈õledziƒá nas na Twiterze: @GdgPoznan

events.name: GDG Pozna≈Ñ: Android Meetup #3
events.description:
Zapraszamy na kolejne spotkanie GDG Pozna≈Ñ. Tym razem szykujcie siƒô na bardziej zaawansowane prelekcje w temacie Androida.

Patronatem wydarzenia bƒôdzie Merixstudio - zesp√≥≈Ç ponad 120 ekspert√≥w, kt√≥rzy tworzƒÖ aplikacje webowe i mobilne dla klient√≥w z ca≈Çego ≈õwiata.

Agenda:
17:30 - 18:00 Rejestracja
18:00 - 18:45 Agnieszka Janicka: "Jetpack Compose - jak zbudowaƒá deklaratywny UI na Androidzie"
18:45 - 19:00 Przerwa
19:00 - 19:45 Wojtek Kalici≈Ñski: "From callbacks to coroutines: building a KTX library"
19:45 Networking przy üçï

Opis prelekcji:

1) Agnieszka Janicka: "Jetpack Compose - jak zbudowaƒá deklaratywny UI na Androidzie"

W tej prezentacji znajdziesz odpowied≈∫ na pytania:
Jak stworzyƒá UI korzystajƒÖc z Jetpack Compose? Jak stworzyƒá sw√≥j w≈Çasny komponent? Jak u≈ºyƒá Compose w istniejƒÖcej aplikacji?

2) Wojtek Kalici≈Ñski: "From callbacks to coroutines: building a KTX library"

A closer look at the lower-level building blocks of coroutines and Flow that let you transition existing Java-based APIs into a Kotlin coroutine world. I'll use a small KTX (Kotlin Extensions) library for one of the Android APIs as an example and show you how to implement your own.

---

Przypominamy:
- wydarzenie jest darmowe
- uczestnictwo w wydarzeniu jest jednoznaczne ze zgodƒÖ na wykonywanie i publikacjƒô zdjƒôƒá przez GDG Pozna≈Ñ oraz Merixstudio w celu udokumentowania spotkania

- - - - - - -

Od teraz mo≈ºesz ≈õledziƒá nas na Twiterze: @GdgPoznan oraz pod hasztagiem #GDGPoznan.

events.name: GDG Pozna≈Ñ Android & Flutter Meetup #4
events.description:
Hi all!
We want to invite you to join our next Android Meetup but this time we're online and all in English!

The agenda:
17:50 opening a Zoom

18:00 Meetup starts

Piotr ≈ölesarew "MVI hidden superpowers"
There are many architectural patterns. They are all great when used properly, but none of them is "The One and Only". In this talk, I would like to share with you how I got inspired by MVI hidden superpowers and what kind of benefits you can get by implementing Unidirectional Data Flow.

short break

Matej Re≈°et√°r "Adding beautiful Flutter UI to native Android"
Building richly animated and beautiful user interfaces comes naturally with Flutter. You can take control of literally every pixel on the screen and target Android, iOS, web, and desktop! The problem is that you may have already built the app separately for each platform and rewriting everything from scratch in Flutter is unthinkable... That's not a problem! You can enrich the user experience by embedding beautifully looking (and performant) Flutter views inside your native app.

About our speakers:

Piotr ≈ölesarew | Senior Android Developer @ Babylon Health
Twitter: @SliskiCode

Professional and ambitious dreamer with more than nine years of experience in designing and implementing advanced Android applications. Conference speaker, technical articles writer, and GDG Krak√≥w organizer. Lately focused on Kotlin language and Unidirectional Data Flow.

Matej Re≈°et√°r
Twitter: @resocoder

Matej is an app developer with a knack for teaching others. He is working as a Flutter freelancer and, most importantly, a developer educator at resocoder.com with a mission to get people prepared for the real world of Flutter development. Despite all this work, he still manages to squeeze in tough workouts üí™ and guitar üé∏.

The link to the Zoom will be attached before the meeting.

Follow us on Twitter @GdgPoznan and via hashtag #GDGPoznan

upcoming.name: GDG Pozna≈Ñ: Touch the Clouds Meetup #2
upcoming.description:
Hi all!
We want to invite you to join our next Cloud Meetup but this time we're online and all in English!

The agenda:
17:50 opening a Zoom

18:00 Meetup starts

Kamil Brzezi≈Ñski "Managed Instance Groups in Google Cloud Platform - live demo"
Managing a huge scale of virtual machines may be challenging. I want to present how to manage instances using managed instance groups on Google Cloud Platform. I will perform live demo showing how does it work in real life rather than showing sales slides.

Konrad C≈Çapa & Jarek Gajewski "Hi Anthos!"
Get started with how to start your adventure with Anthos.
#Anthos #AnthosServiceMesh #AnthosConfigManager #HybridCloud #MultiCloud

About our speakers:

Kamil Brzezi≈Ñski
Twitter: @KamilBrzezinski

Kamil is a Product Manager at Google, responsible for the development of Google Compute Engine services. Google for Startups Accelerator program mentor. Experienced with public cloud products and solutions launching different customer facing products. Used to work for media and gaming industries, e-commerce, and social networks. Launches various mobile applications and games in the past. Education, logistics, gaming startups co-founder in technical roles. MSc in Electronic and Telecommunication. Private pilot and gamer in free time.

Konrad C≈Çapa
Twitter: @clapa_konrad

Konrad is a Chief Cloud Architect working for Atos. He holds over 30 industry certification including all 9 on Google Cloud Platform. He is recognised as one of the Google Cloud Certified Fellows. Sharing knowledge has been a key value for him so he contributes to the community being a leader for local GDG Cloud Group. Konrad is also an author of a Professional Cloud Architect ‚Äì Google Cloud Certification Guide.

Jarek Gajewski
Twitter: @jarek_gajewski

Jarek works as a Lead Cloud Architect at AtoS GDC.
AtoS Senior Expert in the field of Cloud, VMware Certified Implementation Expert in the field of automation and virtualization, Google Certified Professional Cloud Architect.
According to the motto, if you already do something, do it right or not at all, get to know and explore something new constantly.

The link to the Zoom will be attached before the meeting.
